alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:24AM EDT until June 27 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER AND NORTHERN ACCOMACK COUNTIES... At 1224 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Newark to 16 miles southeast of Snow Hill to 23 miles east of Parksley, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties, including the following locations... Boxiron and Public Landing. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
